pullRequest.body:
Co-authored-by: Adam Topaz [topaz@ualberta.ca](mailto:topaz@ualberta.ca) @adamtopaz 
Basics of the category `Stonean` of extremally disconnected compact Hausdorff spaces. This work was done during the 2023 Copenhagen masterclass on formalisation of condensed mathematics. Numerous participants contributed.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: I've modified everything according to Adam's suggestions
@dagurtomas Please click "resolve conversation" on all the conversations above that you consider done. (Unless you still want a maintainer to look/reply to a conversation.)
Merging master and waiting for CI to build to be able to use `#find_home`
Two comments, but apart from that, LGTM

> Two comments, but apart from that, LGTM

Done
Hmm, CI canceled the check "Detect changes to header SHAs / Add annotations (pull_request)". What does that mean?
That check broke following a change in the way we do those headers. Please merge master. That should fix it.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge
All this stuff can be shortened using the `cocone` and `isColimit` constructions above.
This should go in the `ExtremallyDisconnected` file.
Since `inferInstance` works, this is probably not necessary.
We should add a suitable instance for topological spaces, and use that instance here.

```suggestion
/-- Projective implies ExtrDisc. -/
```
I don't think `surj` is needed, is it? It seems that `pi` is also unused, as you introduce `e` as variables everywhere.
Hmm... I'd say they do. :-)

```suggestion
/-- `Projective` implies `ExtrDisc`. -/
```

```suggestion
  obj X := 
  { toCompHaus := X.compHaus,
```
Very minor...
These should live somewhere earlier. Try `#find_home sigma_mk_preimage_image'`.

```suggestion
```
I don't object to this style at all, but some people prefer to write `inferInstanceAs <| TopologicalSpace X.compHaus`.
This shouldn't be an instance!!

```suggestion
instance : Full toProfinite where
  preimage f := f
```
more readable!
Same comment about the file name.
This mostly repeats line 17. I think you can remove this paragraph (and maybe add the "basic observations about ..." bit to the paragraph on L17.

I think this should be factored out into a separate instance. In Lean 4 it is not a problem to have cycles in the type class hierarchy. So for `X : CompHaus` I think we should have a cycle `extrDisc -> Projective -> extrDisc`.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: define the category of extremally disconnected compact Hausdorff spaces

nodes.body: I've modified everything according to Adam's suggestions

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: projectivity of `Stonean` in `CompHaus`
